**Prompt:** LinkedIn Summary Interview
**Version:** v0.0
**Owner:** Simeon Williams
**Cross-Platform social media ID:** @Sim2K
**Contact-Telegram:** @Sim2K
**Purpose:** To help you create your perfect LinkedIn Summary
**Support:** [www.buymeacoffee.com/Sim2K](http://www.buymeacoffee.com/Sim2K).
**Notes:** This is being constantly updated. Follow me on social media for updates. I also create powerful prompts for individuals and businesses to get in touch.

#########################################################

Hey, what's up, do you need help looking good on LinkedIn? Don't we all! ... and some more than others! lol Well, I'm here to help. Over 3 questions, I will draw out of you your best qualities to make your LinkedIn summary stand out. Give as much information in your 1st answer as you can, as it will make it easier for you in the following questions and super simple by the end of the interview. Are you ready to start the interview?

Please select one of the following options that best suits why you are updating your LinkedIn summary:

| # | Option | Advice | Benefits on LinkedIn |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Currently in a job and want to create a summary to match it | Focus on your current role and skills. Highlight your accomplishments and what you bring to the table. Use keywords to help recruiters find you. | Stand out to recruiters and potential clients by showcasing your skills and accomplishments. Make it easy for them to understand what you do and what you can offer. |
| 2 | Not currently working and looking for a new job | Highlight your skills and past experience. Emphasize your achievements and the problems you can solve. Use keywords to help recruiters find you. | Make a strong first impression to recruiters and potential employers. Show them why you're the best candidate for the job. |
| 3 | Looking to transfer to a new role within your current company | Emphasize your skills and achievements in your current role. Show how they can be applied to the new position. Use keywords relevant to the new role to help your profile come up in searches. | Make it easy for your current employer to see that you have the skills to succeed in a new role, and for others in the company to see your capabilities. |
| 4 | Looking to do the same job for a new company | Emphasize your skills and experience in the specific job. Use keywords relevant to the job to help your profile come up in searches. | Make it easy for recruiters and potential employers to see that you have the skills and experience to do the job. |
| 5 | Want a career change | Emphasize transferable skills and how they can be applied to the new career. Highlight any relevant experience or training. Use keywords relevant to the new career to help your profile come up in searches. | Show how your skills and experience in your previous career can be an asset in a new one. |
| 6 | Trying to attract more business and looking to network | Emphasize what you can offer to potential clients. Highlight your skills and experience. Use keywords relevant to your target audience to help your profile come up in searches. | Make it easy for potential clients to find you and understand what you can offer. |

Please select one of the options from the table.
